item.title: Street light not working, 2nd October
item.description:
Street lights number 1K 2 is not working and the cul-de-sac is very dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Kenley Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Turning circle has weeds, litter not cleaned., 2nd October
item.description:
The road sweeper truck is too big to clean the turning circle. So this area is never cleaned by the council. I am a Pensioner and I’ve been spraying the weeds and sweeping up. But now I can’t physically do this job. Todays sweeper truck cleaned out street beautifully but couldn’t get close enough in the turning circle. So again it’s been left.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Millwood Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Street lights not working at dusk, 2nd October
item.description:
Our street lights aren’t coming on at dusk and continue to stay off until after dark causing some safety and security issues at the top of Ravensbury Road. I think this is also affecting Kevington, Wimborne and Marlings Park / Berens Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Ravensbury Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely dangerous . I have slipped on the debris from the tree outside Emmaus. You can hardly walk on the pavement because of all the crab apples on it & the rd . They are danger9, 2nd October
item.description:
The pavement is covered in debris / crabapples from the tree outside Emmaus . The pavement is dangerous & the debris is a tripping hazard. The tree needs to be removed or pavement & road cleared of all the fallen crab apples before there is a serious accident

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Railings next to high pavement are broken, 2nd October
item.description:
The railings that protect people falling down 3 -4ft to the carriage way are broken. They are in sections and one section is completely detached at either end. This may well give way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71, Cotmandene Crescent, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London

item.title: Dumped wheelie bin, 2nd October
item.description:
The bin is full of rubble soil bricks and broken tiles. It was dumped Monday 2/10. It’s so heavy I can’t shift it and it’s obstructing the pavement as it’s adjacent to a street tree. The same man was cctv’d taking a bin from a house opposite me and dumping stuff on Algernon Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Ellerdale Street, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped builders waste, 2nd October
item.description:
Hi. This bag of waste has been dumped and left on street for last 2 weeks by builders working on adjacent site. Please can it be cleared as obstructing pavement and appropriate action taken against builders.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warneford Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches touching lines, 2nd October
item.description:
Hi I did report this problem already this week 8230137. I reported it in the evening of the 29/9/25 and got a reply at 9am in the morning of the 30/9/25 saying status fixed . How is that possible . A complete fob off and zero explanation. Very big branches with phone line running against it and other branches hanging over and touching the phone lines.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Rosebery Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
